sequence.text: As you’re taking a round in the warehouse in the morning, Dev approaches you with a complaint against his team mate, Kumar
Kumar and I are scheduled for the same warehouse shift.
He regularly plays games on his cell phone while I pick the orders.
I have to do the bulk of the work while he plays.
I've asked him on four different occasions to help me, but he doesn't listen to me.

content.description: You’ve already reprimanded Kumar in the past about his slack behaviour. What kind of disciplinary action should you take against him now?
options: Send Kumar a notification of termination
Scold Kumar in front of his team mates
Set strict productivity targets for Kumar

reactions.confirmText: Are you sure you want to terminate Kumar without giving him a chance to take responsibility?
reactions.text: You’ve fired Kumar without allowing him a chance to take responsibility. This has negatively affected the morale of the employees. Workers feel that your response was disproportionate to Kumar’s offence and now feel discouraged and worried about their own job security.

reactions.confirmText: Are you sure you want to embarrass Kumar like that?
reactions.text: You gave Kumar a dressing down in front of others. He resents you now as he has become a laughing stock for a group of warehouse workers. He wants to quit and his friends are not happy about how things panned out either.

reactions.confirmText: Are you sure you want to give Kumar a second chance?
reactions.text: You did the right thing by giving Kumar a chance to take responsibility and become more professional. You made him and—by extension—others in the team feel supported and laid the ground for cultivating a more trusting relationship with the employees.

sequence.text: You’re having a meal in the break room when you hear some gossip about Maya shouting at Jay the day before. You see Jay and Maya separately and ask them what had happened.

I clean out the shared refrigerator regularly and accidentally threw out Maya’s leftovers yesterday. She absolutely went off at me for that! No one appreciates the effort I put in to keep this place clean.
I had left some food in the fridge and found it missing! What gave Jay the right to discard it? People should respect others’ personal belongings..

content.description: Jay and Maya are not speaking to each other. How should you handle this situation?
options: Avoid confrontation as long as it doesn’t affect their productivity
Talk to Maya and tell her not to take Jay’s action personally
Facilitate a discussion between the two to arrive at a resolution

reactions.confirmText: Are you sure you want to avoid any confrontations?
reactions.text: It’s not good to let conflicts fester in the workplace. It may not affect their productivity, but it might affect the general environment at work and there’s a real chance that one or both individuals may engage in passive-aggressive behaviour.

reactions.confirmText: Are you sure you want to talk to only Maya?
reactions.text: Research has shown that telling people not to take conflicts personally doesn’t work. Regardless of such a disclaimer, Maya is very likely to hold a grudge against Jay that will ultimately affect their working relationship.

reactions.confirmText: Are you sure you want to spend time on discussing such a minor issue?
reactions.text:
The sooner you address an issue and allow employees to engage in a dialogue, the sooner they can go back to a healthy working relationship and remain productive and engaged. 
Ask both parties to share their perspectives and invite them to come up with ideas for a resolution that may include apologies or changes in behaviour (labelling food containers, in this case, for instance) to prevent similar disputes from recurring.
